page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO ONGAR
page.content: Ongar has 6000 inhabitants.{Chelmsford the county town is eleven miles away. Chipping Ongar comes from the Saxon {Cheaping Angre}which means{"market on {the wooded slope";}though there is no longer a market in Ongar. We do not know at what time the Saxons were here, because they left no written records, all we can tell is that they were here after the Romans but before the Normans. We know this because there is a will from 1044, mentioning Ongar. Ongar is a large village or small town, depending on definition. There are a variety of architectural styles along the main street e.g. Tudor, Regency and Victorian. Brentwood and Epping are both 7 miles from Ongar, which is 26 miles from London.
